metadata.Title: CVE-2014-0088 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The SPDY implementation in the ngx_http_spdy_module module in nginx 1.5.10 before 1.5.11, when running on a 32-bit platform, allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted request.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-0088` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

nginx - 1.4.6-1ubuntu3
nginx-common - 1.4.6-1ubuntu3
nginx-core - 1.4.6-1ubuntu3
nginx-extras - 1.4.6-1ubuntu3
nginx-full - 1.4.6-1ubuntu3
nginx-light - 1.4.6-1ubuntu3
nginx-naxsi - 1.4.6-1ubuntu3
nginx-naxsi-ui - 1.4.6-1ubuntu3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nginx package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.4.6-1ubuntu3').
